title: Welcome!
text:
I am a second year Complex Systems Ph.D. student at the University of Vermont in Burlington. Iâ€™m a member of the Computational Story Lab at the Vermont Complex Systems Center.
My main, broad interest is people in complex systems.
Expected graduation date of summer 2028.

title: Welcome!
text:
Research Interests
I am interested in the measuring complex, interpersonal processes in digital mediums. People are motivated to socially connect and often rely on technology and text to do so, leading me in the direction of asking how well technology facilitates this goal and how can we best measure the constructs driving this process in individual and collective levels?

title: Welcome!
text:
Recent News
2024


July: Attended IC2S2 at University of Pennsylvania.
May-June: Biked 560 miles (10k ft elevation) of the Empire State Trail over 9 days from Buffalo, NY to NYC.
May: Finished first year of the CSDS PhD program!
May: Presented in Story Lab on linguistic coordination in the CANDOR conversation corpus.
April: Presented a poster at the UVM Student Research Conference on structuring discussion forum conversations as network data.

2023

Joined the Computational Story Lab and started in the PhD program in Complex Systems and Data Science.

title: About
text:
Before joining the program, I worked in various roles as a research, applied, or data scientist. I applied my prior education in psychology to more applied behavioral science questions, conducting work ranging from survey data collection to representing people in simulations using agent based modeling. Over this professional experience, I became more interested in how we can study and evaluate systems involving people, leading me to find the area of complexity science!

I am otherwise engaged in walking my dogs, planning my next cabin or bike trip, or getting a board game group together. And I might bake something to bring along.
